alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Monroe (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 8:18PM CDT until May 12 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... White River At Augusta affecting Woodruff and White Counties. White River At Clarendon affecting Monroe and Arkansas Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY, MAY 12... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River At Clarendon. * WHEN...Until Friday, May 12. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Flooding of cropland and timber is occurring. Roads to homes and cabins in lower Maddox Bay area off Highway 146 south of Clarendon impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 27.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 27.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday, May 11. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 7 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Crest Time Date White River Clarendon 26.0 27.7 Wed 8 PM 27.5 27.3 27.0 27.7 1 AM 5/04 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
